main event: A meteorologist observed a small bright light during a routine pilot balloon observation using a theodolite on August 7, 1952.
interesting points: The observer could not locate the object again after adjusting the theodolite,The object had the appearance of a bright spot of sunlight with no sound or movement,The object was observed for approximately two minutes,The light appeared to be about 1/20 inch long and 1/10 inch high in the theodolite eyepiece,No physical evidence or identification of the object was made.
witness description: a U.S. Weather Bureau meteorologist with 20 years of experience in balloon observations.
